prices-rising.text: Home prices are rising faster here than anywhere else in the country.

down-doubled.text: The median down payment on a house has doubled to $100,000 in five years.

full-time-job.text: Many buyers described the home-hunting process as a stressful full-time job.

outbid.text: The average buyer is outbid 3-5 times and pursues a house for 6-12 months.

save-up.text: Before even searching for homes, you'll need to save up a lot of money.

squirrel.text: To make real progress, buyers must squirrel away an amount equal to one-fourth of the local median income.

acorn.text: Even people in their 30s and 40s are stuck asking mom and dad for gifts.

stamp.icon: pre-approval stamp “We think this person can buy a home”
stamp.text: A mortgage pre-approval is your basic first qualification but not a loan guarantee.

all-cash.text: About 1 in 4 homes locally are bought entirely with cash, and good luck competing with them.

checklist.icon: pre-written check list - Guaranteed you can buy a home Solid gold buyer!
checklist.text: To really be competitive, you'll need to get "pre-underwritten" for a mortgage at the start.

local-lenders.text: Local lenders known in the real estate community can give you a leg-up to skeptical sellers' brokers.

cake.text: One local lender helped his client get a house by taking calls during his wife’s birthday party.

broker.icon: person with a sash that says neighborhood expert
broker.text: Most brokers specialize in one neighborhood.

over-asking.text: A list price is now just a suggestion: two-thirds of homes go for over asking.

avoid-love.icon: ALERT! Do not fall in love

one-week.icon: ALERT! You may have less than one week to buy a house!

stinker.text: Homes that don't sell quickly attract a "stink" in the market, but they might be hidden opportunities.

off-market.text: Want a real deal? You'll have to know someone who wants to sell without the hassle of listing their home.

duplicate.text: When two similar homes hit the market in the same neighborhood, one is likely to be less sought-after.

appraisal-contingency.text: Appraisal comes in low? You'll have to fork over more cash.

inspection.text: Find something wrong with the house after bidding? That's your problem.

boxes.text: Your home will be available in a few months - once the old owners are able to find a new place.

foam-finger.text: Second place in a bidding war means you're not out of the running yet.
